translated: Verses of the Elder Nuns .
The Group of Fives
The Elder Nun Mittākāḷī
Having gone forth out of faith,
from home to the homeless life,
I wandered around here and there,

analyzed: lābha sakkāra aussukā  riñcitvā paramam attha  a seviha
translated: eager for gain and honor.🔽Having abandoned the highest goal,🔽I pursued a lowly goal,
having gone under the power of defilements,
I did not understand the purpose of the spiritual life.
Then I was overcome with anxiety,
while sitting in the dwelling,
I was on a wrong path,
having come under the power of craving.
My life is short,
old age and disease oppress me;
Before this body breaks up,
it’s not the time for me to be negligent.
Contemplating as it really is
the arising and falling away of the components (of mind and body),
I arose with my mind free,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”
… the elder nun Mittā Kāḷī …
